archimate:ApplicationComponent.name: PACS System
archimate:ApplicationComponent.documentation:
PACS revolutionizes medical imaging by providing digital storage, retrieval, and distribution of medical images and related data. These systems replace traditional film-based imaging with digital workflows, enabling instant access to images from any authorized location within the healthcare network. PACS stores various imaging modalities including X-rays, CT scans, MRIs, ultrasounds, and nuclear medicine studies. The system provides sophisticated viewing tools with capabilities for image manipulation, measurement, and annotation. PACS enables telemedicine consultations, supports artificial intelligence applications for image analysis, and maintains long-term archival storage with disaster recovery capabilities.
Core Functionalities: • Image storage (X-ray, CT, MRI, PET, Ultrasound) • Secure viewing and sharing of images • DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) compliance • Integration with RIS for image reports
Workflows: • Image capture → DICOM tagging → Storage in PACS → Retrieval via RIS/EHR
Data Types: • DICOM images, metadata, access logs
Integration Points: • RIS: Imaging reports • EHR: Embedding images in patient records • HIS: Linking image orders to patients
Example Software: • Sectra PACS • Philips IntelliSpace PACS • Merge PACS (IBM) • Agfa HealthCare PACS
• Relationships:
o Stores data in → Storage SAN: Requires large storage capacity for images o Integrates with → EHR: Makes images available in patient records o Used by → Radiology Department: Primary system for radiologists o Requires → High Bandwidth Network: For transferring large image files
